title: Bot lane champions
body:
I was wondering if there were any champions that can work bot lane, other than marksman ADCs and support champions, I want to duo bot with my friend but I don't like marksman champs, if there are any champs who are they??

Thanks in advance

replies.body:
You havnt heard of the Israeli 'Defence Policy' bot lane? 
Syndra Zillian. Bomb the low enemy minion, syndra picks it up, zil speeds her up, she drops the bomb, ADC now 25% hp.

If you're looking for something without a marksman in bot lane, you're going to find the most success with a kill lane, or a champion with sustained magic damage. This is because you'll always struggle to trade effectively in lane without the sustained damage that can be applied by a marksman / ADC. 

This generally means either:

1) High CC Lockdown + High Damage bot lanes. This includes combos with J4/Xin/Leo/Pantheon/Alistar/Taric/Sion/Poppy with each other,  or with an easily applied CC mage with burst, like Annie/Veigar/Syndra/Kennen. If you get ahead with early kills in this lane, the enemy bot lane will struggle to get farm for a very long time due to your huge lockdown + kill threat. You'll likely not want to push down their tower because once you take it, it's a lot safer for them to farm, and you can't apply your threat anywhere near as well.

2) Sustained Damage Mages - The best example here is generally Ryze - he's able to apply consistent magic damage at medium-ish range, and with protection from a good support can manage to scale well with items just as well as experience. Other characters that work well like this include Azir (who works kinda like a marksman) and Lulu (who has ridiculously strong auto-attacks when itemised for it, combined with her natural tanky ult/shield and W utility).

Kennen is also a bit of dark horse here for either field: he [has one of the best attack speeds](http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/List_of_champions%27_attack_speed), especially early - and [compares favourably on AD](http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/List_of_champions%27_attack_damage) with most typical ADC, as well as a reasonable 550 auto range. This pretty unique stat makeup, no mana, and some pretty useful skills for bot lane (longer range harass, movement, AR/MR boost, build in stun, a great auto attack booster and an aoe ultimate that he can auto attack during!) let him act as a bully to ADCs early, and then lets him build as as a straight mage (or pretty much anything!) as he begins to build items.
So kennen would be a good choice?
Depends on what your friend is playing! Kennen is just one that is going to work with either style :)
Blitzcrank and Alistar, enjoy making the enemy ADC ragequit.
There isn't really anything that works competitively but there are some fun double bruiser bot lanes that can work pretty well in normals. Such as leona/panth, j4/xin, blitz/ali.
